Reviews.Title: “Beware: The worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Dawn A
Reviews.Content: Don't be tempted by this place. Great location and low price lured us in. But it was dirty, inhospitable, noisy, and with poor service. Our names and reservations were on the books, but it took them 20 minutes to figure out which rooms we should be in, mostly because we had booked rooms with a private bathroom. My friend struggled with her bags while the two desk clerks watched. We asked for drinking glasses and were told to go to the gelato shop next door to get plastic cups. (Sorry, Mr. Desk Clerk, for interrupting your ongoing personal phone calls.) No one checked our name against the room register when we asked for our key off the peg board -- anyone could walked off the street and gotten our room key. The room doors were flimsy and not secure. No in-room safe. The shower was grimy and the shower head was broken. Water was hot, linen was clean. Lack of carpeting and flimsy doors made the room noisy because of all the hotel foot traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, UNBEATABLE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Anna I
Reviews.Content: Went for 2 days and ended up staying 5. Its not a fancy hotel but who wants to be inside the hotel room when you're in Rome. Erdarelli will provide you with breakfast, clean rooms and fresh towels everyday, maps and brochures and a quiet sleep. Staff was professional, friendly and willing to accomodate. This is where Im staying next time, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location, friendly staff, clean but well worn decor, a perfect base to visit this magical city.”
Reviews.Author: Sally24_7
Reviews.Content: Get past the dated decor and you will realise this is a gem of a place. Spent 5 days here on a shoe string budget and had an amazing time. There were singles, couples and families there during our stay. It's not the Ritz but the rooms were spotlessly clean, the air con worked, the shower was hot and the bed was large and comfortable. The rooms are small, but space is an issue in Rome and this will be the case pretty much anywhere central unless you pay big bucks for the privilege. It is a family run place and the staff were very friendly, the breakfast was staple continental and of the same standard you would get in a much pricier place in Rome. This was my fourth visit to the city and for location, and price it was the best, almost exactly in between the Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain (both two mins walk away). If you are looking for a cheap, clean, quiet and safe place to stay in the thick of it then I wholeheartly recommend it. Will definitely come back here for my next visit. The only downside- the lift is very old fashioned so if you have an issue with that and have an aversion to stairs I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quaint, but not for people who are demanding”
Reviews.Author: mercedesem
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very qaint and extremely well located. In the center of Rome, the price was very reasonable. The rooms are spacious and calm, but some of them do not have a bathroom. This means you have to leave your room to go to the bathroom. Since they are shared, they are not in optimal condition. It is a perfect hotel for students who wish to stay in Rome in a central location, but less suited for families or demanding people.

Reviews.Title: “Location location loaction!!!”
Reviews.Author: buttons21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4nights in July it was our first time in Rome and we wanted to stay somewhere with a good location at a affordable price. The hotel was very basic and run down but the location was perfect and there was work being done to the hotel at the time so its a working progress. I had read some of the previous comments about the hotel before I stayed and thought it would be worse then it was. Although the hotel was old and in need of some TLC it was clean the people were very friendly. We didn’t spend much time in the hotel so the location was more important to us than the place itself. One of the main tourist buses the 116 stops right outside the hotel making it so easy to get to all the attractions or if you don’t mind a stroll you can walk to most of them. Overall the location to us outweighed the hotel itself; the place was clean which is all that really mattered I have stayed in far worse places. One thing I would say is the room didn’t have any air con or even a fan and it did get quite hot, we slept with the window open which meant a very noisy road in the morning, this didn’t bother us to much as we had lots plan for our trip but if you like to sleep in late maybe ask for a room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you're wanting an American hotel in Rome this is not for you.”
Reviews.Author: JBridger89
Reviews.Content: I think that a lot of these reviews are written by people who were expecting the Hilton. You can find those hotels if you want to pay that much. When you're paying what you are and are in a city that is famous for how old it is and there are very few new constructions this hotel is great. It is old, if you get a room with a shared bathroom you need to be prepared to-wait for it-share a bathroom. Again, this isn't the Ritz. If that's what you want stay somewhere else. But you will not get the fantastic location this has to offer. I could get everywhere by walking if I wanted and the metro is close by. It is literally a block away from all the expensive shopping (Gucci, YSL, Prada), the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and if you're up for a little walk the Parthenon. I didn't come to Rome for the hotel room, I came for the experience. I'm a college age male so I would say if you're a family, or you're wanting to sleep a lot, this hotel can be a little noisy. It didn't bother me, but I can see how other people may not enjoy that. I also want to give a shout-out to a little restaurant I ate at while staying in Rome. I found it in Rick Steve's guide of Rome. It is pretty close to Erdarelli and is one of the best that I ate at while in Italy. It's called L'Antica Birreria Peroni. A block off Via del Corso at Via di San Marcello 19. Eat there!

Reviews.Title: “funky smell”
Reviews.Author: akc2122
Reviews.Content: Nice guys manning the place, although one of them passed out during his overnight shift and we waited outside in the rain for like 10 minutes before opening the door for us. The hotel itself is pretty nasty. One of the showers didn't even have a [--] damn shower head -- just a faucet. I felt like I was showering like a peasant during Caesar's time. Whenever we'd walk into the room, it had the funkiest smell and took a few minutes to get used to it. The shampoo we got basically made my hair fall out. The room itself felt pretty dirty. There were hairs in my bed. Gross. The breakfast was atrocious. If cheap pastries is your idea of breakfast, then welcome to heaven. If all you want is location, then you've got a good place. Other than that, stay the [--] away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Bad conditions.”
Reviews.Author: leobopp
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Erdarelli is it's location. A few blocks walking from Piazza di Spagna and Fontana di Trevi. The coffee and the staff were average. The bad evaluations go for the rooms, very ugly and old.

Reviews.Title: “This place is gross and has ants”
Reviews.Author: lpearson337
Reviews.Content: Really gross and dirty and smelly place. The location is great, but it's not worth it. Our room smelled very strongly of deodorizer. They were definitely trying to cover something up. The room was tiny with 2 single beds. The bathroom was large but there was no shower curtain, so the bathroom got very wet when you showered. The wallpaper was dirty and peeling off the walls and the bed covers were dirty as was the floor. We also had ants in the room and when we told the front desk guy at checkout he did not seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for and less”
Reviews.Author: aer11
Reviews.Content: Location is great, near trevi fountain, spanish steps as well as 2 metro stops are 5 min walking distance. Thats about it. Rooms/bath are completely outdated, wallpaper peeling and dirty. Breakfast room is neat and clean but outdated as well. Breakfast less than average, cookies, few rolls, and some pie/danish. Staff, not very friendly, they didn't even welcome me to their hotel, some were incredibly bothered if asked for help while others were not as bothered but still reluctant. Moderate language barrier, thankfully i speak spanish which made it easier. The only way I would ever stay there again is if I were completely desperate to visit Rome as I was this time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel - best location.”
Reviews.Author: opheliabuttocks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent a week at this hotel. We were on the fourth floor at the front of the hotel and we have the following comments: - room tiny and 'double' bed was 2 small single beds pushed together - wallpaper was peeling off the walls - no air conditioning, and with temperatures at 35+ degrees this wasn't good - single glazed windows which we had to keep open anyway due to heat meant we had the full volume of what seemed to be the noisiest street in Rome (I'm sure we heard tanks one night) - bathroom minute...it was a pod-like thing in the corner of the room that would have served well as a sauna but was hopeless as a bathroom. And, as others have said, the shower is minute. If you are over 6 feet tall or have a few extra lbs then don't expect to get in. And god forbid if you want to shave your legs. - no hairdryer, tea making facilities, bottled water, etc - hotel was no smoking but some staff smoked at reception so you had to walk past clouds of smoke on occasion - renovations were ongoing (which will be good in the long run) but meant we had to climb over painters on the stairs - breakfast was continental but not great. Individually wrapped cheese slices (a la Kraft), cheese triangles, juice, hard buns, croissants which were glazed with sugar, juice, water and a hot drinks machine with the worst coffee I've ever had. Positives are: - it's in a good location - 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain - close to Metro station and all trips only 1 euro - cost was 'affordable' BUT don't book through third party company - go straight to hotel website. We used Bookings.com and paid more than we could have. - staff all seemed to speak a bit of English so easy to book in/out, ask questions - they gave us a corkscrew to use when we asked - gelati shop right next door (also sells beer and wine - open late) - near lots of cafes/restaurants and 15 mins walk from a large park - the lift worked (if previous user shut the doors after themselves) So, if you want somewhere a bit shabby (and I'm not just talking old here) but in the centre for a half decent price then go here. If you can afford more - don't.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT couldn't stay one night”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynNYCGal
Reviews.Content: I decided to do an overnight trip in Rome on my way back home from a week long trip in Sicily. I booked at the Erdarelli primarily due to the location. I saw the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor but thought "How bad could it really be?" besides, I was only staying for 1 night. Well, it was bad! This place is not a hotel, it's more of a hostel. I am a single woman from New York City, it takes a lot for me to feel unsafe, but from the minute I stepped into the hotel I got a bad feeling. Got worse as I located my room which was in a dark corner (literally no lighting) on the 3rd floor. Then when I opened the door which has a cheap key lock, I was taken aback by the room. A tiny twin sized bed with a worn and stained blanket. But the worst was the smell. The room smelled old and musty, so strong that when I left the room the smell remained on my clothing. The shower was tiny with black mildew lined corners and a dirty bath mat. Surprisingly, the towels were actually clean and white. I used all my might to not make a rash decision and bolt. So I left the hotel to clear my head, have some dinner and visit a few sites. The location is superb, minutes to the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, and the Pantheon. However, during dinner I couldn't get over the feeling of dread of returning to the hotel. At 1:00 AM, I returned to the hotel and checked out. Despite knowing that I would have only been sleeping there a few hours before checking out in the morning, I couldn't stomach being in that dreadful hotel and using that shower in the morning. I ended up checking in at the Hotel Concordia just around the corner. If you don't mind hostel quality boarding then the Erdarelli might work for you, particularly because of the excellent location. Otherwise, save yourself the time and frustration and book somewhere else. There are plenty of 'real' hotels nearby of better quality with reasonable nightly rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Pompeiipink
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located within walking distance to most of the sites. Staff is very accomodating and friendly. It is a very old hotel but it was very clean. We had fresh towels daily. If you've never been to Europe, be prepared for a very small shower...it's common. This hotel is a good choice if you want to walk everywhere but it really has no ammenities. I don't recommend it for families with small children. It's great for people on a budget as the rates are very good especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: RLC31
Reviews.Content: Hotel was old and a little out of date but clean. The perfect spot to sleep, clean up, and be on the go again. The staff was wonderful, helpful and very friendly. The location was perfect; easy walking distance to every historic area. The Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain were within a 5 minute walk. The Pantheon was a 6 or 7 minute walk. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a basic no frills place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A timewarp!”
Reviews.Author: Jonas W
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is what a traveller that hates the "international style" hotels wants! Personality, traditions, the genuine. Pensione Erdarelli is a family run business since 1935. Not much has been changed over the years - thank God. It feels like being in a David Lynch film, old heavy curtains, red vinyl chairs, dim light... The room is simple but with good style. Big room. One of my windows is opening towards the Borromini baroque church St Andrea delle Fratte. That is special. The bed is big and comfortable. New linen every day, even though it is totally unnecessary. The breakfast is in a typical continental style, café, tea, bread, jam. You can order egg, toast and other dishes too, it is all really cheap. Besides that this is probably the coolest looking hotel in Rome, it has also a remarkably nice location. Just between the Piazza di Spagna and Fontana di Trevi. All historical sites are more and less within walking distance. I recommend this hotel or Pensione, to anyone who is through with the boring standard hotels, superficial servility, who wants the genuine, the simple. Forget about wi-fi zones, free internet, Spa, fitness whatever... Lay down in your room and read a good book, listen to the city, the bells of St Andrea delle Fratte...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stopoverqueen
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations directly from their site as my sister-in-law had recommended it. The location is excellent and if you go on to their site it gives directions as to how to get to the hotel by train and metro. HUGE help as you avoid the hassle of having to take a taxi and run the danger of being cheated. The room was clean, but very, very basic. Think small and narrow for the shower space. Central location meant one could walk everywhere and the buses and metro are close by. You can get directions from the manager to go anywhere. We even took the bus to the catacombs. Save yourself a lot of money by not having to pay for tours.

Reviews.Title: “a bit worn, but friendly and great value”
Reviews.Author: CanariesPA
Reviews.Content: The Pensione Erdarelli is very well located near the Spanish Steps (Spagna), the Barberini metro stop (and the excellent fountain nearby), the Trevi fountain, and the Borghese Gardens - it's also walkable to the Vatican and the Colosseum/Forum area. Restaurants abound and gelateria are next door and across the street. For placement alone, given its price, it is good value. Yes, it is a bit faded. Yes, breakfast is sparse. Yes, the beds are *very* soft and the decor (though with some oddly excellent artwork here and there) is early 1960s (one feels there should be plastic on the sofas.) Yet that also has its charm, from the old-fashioned, tiny lift (and in Rome, that there is a lift matters) to the nooks and crannies. Everything works, and everyone is very friendly. We stayed here with our kids for three nights and would happily do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: AjensenDenmark
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and 3 teenage kids) and I stayed at the Erdarelli Hotel for 3 nights in July 2007, and we chose the hotel because of its location which couldn't be better. We stayed in one 3-bed room and one doubleroom, and though small and very basic, the rooms were OK: very clean, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms very clean and ok size. Our rooms were facing the backyard which didn't give much of a view, but it was very quiet. Breakfast on 3rd floor was served by a nice old lady; a roll, a "cake", toast cheese, jam, juice and coffee/tea. If you're in Rome for sightseeing and not for hanging out in your hotel, and if you want a clean, basic room the Erdarelli is an OK choice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but affordable”
Reviews.Author: sk999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in rome for 5 nights and found it basic but clean. It is a very affordable place to stay in rome, near to most things. There is a metro stop five minutes walk away and a five minute walk in one direction will bring you to the spanish steps and ten mins in the other direction to the trevi fountain. The staff in the hotel were polite but not overly friendly. Breakfast was terrible but that is to be expected in most roman hotels. Over all if you are planning a budget holiday in rome, one step above a hostel this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgracefull.”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Miyagi
Reviews.Content: Checked in, saw the room, rejected it, looked at other rooms, checked out! Don't believe the pictures on the website, maybe that's how they were twenty years ago , but bear little resemblace to the hotels current run down state. Rooms dirty (ingrained dirt) peeling wallpaper etc. Wouldn't kennel my dog here - be afraid - very afraid. Should have took photographs but in too much of a hurry to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Our worst hotel experience in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Mister_MK4
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Italy, we stayed in five hotels, all of which were fantastic.... except this one. To begin, the entire hotel smells of smoke. We booked non-smoking rooms and yet each of our three rooms had not one, not two, but three ashtrays in each room. The beds were, in fact, cots. All amenities were a joke... bathtubs/showers were tiny, A/C did not work. One room's 'balcony' was a 2-foot by 2-foot concrete patch overlooking the inner bowels of the building. The included breakfast... well, its better not to speak of this. By far the worst food we had in Italy, and everything was pre-packaged! And, to top everything off, each room was so dirty that we needed to bathe wearing sandals. Please, do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. We left this hotel after one night, and found a vacancy in another hotel for only €5 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel style”
Reviews.Author: jharris1313
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room over the internet. Euro 145 per night we got a room with an army style bed (with a tattered bed spread) and a private bathroom that was probably 6 ft. wide by 3 ft deep, consisting of a toilet on the wall, a sink, and a shower head in the wall with a drain in the middle of the floor- Americans; think really cheap summer camp. The whole building smelled like mold and we left immediately and checked into a hotel a few doors down for less and it was extremely clean- smelled like bleach (much to my wife's pleasure after the Erdarelli). This place is the worst deal in Rome- we checked into the Hotel Piazza di Spagna on the same block for a cleaner and larger room for less money!

Reviews.Title: “Small and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is ok but the room was small and dingy. The blanket looked and smelled as if it hasn't been washed in 10 years. The desk, chair, even clothes hangers were all dusky. In sum, the hotel is overpriced and I would not recommend it to other travellers.

HotelInfo.Name: Erdarelli
HotelInfo.Address: Via Dei Due Macelli 28, 00187 Rome, Italy
